ch.qos.logback.core

Class FileAppender<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.qos.logback.core.spi.ContextAwareBase
      • ch.qos.logback.core.UnsynchronizedAppenderBase<E>
        • ch.qos.logback.core.OutputStreamAppender<E>
          • ch.qos.logback.core.FileAppender<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Appender<E>, ContextAware, FilterAttachable<E>, LifeCycle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RollingFileAppender

    public class FileAppender<E>
extends OutputStreamAppender<E>
    FileAppender appends log events to a file. For more information about this appender, please refer to the online manual at http://logback.qos.ch/manual/appenders.html#FileAppender

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Type Property and Description
      String rawFile
      This method is used by derived classes to obtain the raw file property.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean append
      Append to or truncate the file? The default value for this variable is true, meaning that by default a FileAppender will append to an existing file and not truncate it.
      protected String fileName
      The name of the active log file.

    • Property Detail

      • rawFile

        public final String rawFileProperty
        This method is used by derived classes to obtain the raw file property. Regular users should not be calling this method. Note that RollingFilePolicyBase requires public getter for this property.

    • Field Detail

      • append

        protected boolean append
        Append to or truncate the file? The default value for this variable is true, meaning that by default a FileAppender will append to an existing file and not truncate it.

      • fileName

        protected String fileName
        The name of the active log file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileAppender

        public FileAppender()

    • Method Detail

      • setFile

        public void setFile(String file)
        The File property takes a string value which should be the name of the file to append to.
        Parameters:
        file - path to destination log file

      • isAppend

        public boolean isAppend()
        Returns the value of the Append property.
        Returns:
        true if file should be appended to instead of overwritten

      • rawFileProperty

        public final String rawFileProperty()
        This method is used by derived classes to obtain the raw file property. Regular users should not be calling this method. Note that RollingFilePolicyBase requires public getter for this property.

      • getFile

        public String getFile()
        Returns the value of the File property.
        Returns:
        the path to the destination log file

      • start

        public void start()
        If the value of File is not null, then openFile(java.lang.String) is called with the values of File and Append properties.
        Specified by:
        start in interface LifeCycle
        Overrides:
        start in class OutputStreamAppender<E>

      • openFile

        protected boolean openFile(String filename)
                    throws IOException

        Sets and opens the file where the log output will go. The specified file must be writable.

        If there was already an opened file, then the previous file is closed first.

        Do not use this method directly. To configure a FileAppender or one of its subclasses, set its properties one by one and then call start().

        Parameters:
        filename - The path to the log file.
        Returns:
        true if successful; false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - file could not be opened

      • isPrudent

        public boolean isPrudent()
        Returns:
        true if in prudent mode
        See Also:
        setPrudent(boolean)

      • setPrudent

        public void setPrudent(boolean prudent)
        When prudent is set to true, file appenders from multiple JVMs can safely write to the same file.
        Parameters:
        prudent - whether to enable prudent mode

      • setAppend

        public void setAppend(boolean append)

      • getLazy

        public boolean getLazy()
        Gets the enable status of lazy initialization of the file output stream
        Returns:
        true if enabled; false otherwise

      • setLazy

        public void setLazy(boolean enable)
        Enables/disables lazy initialization of the file output stream. This defers the file creation until the first outgoing message.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable lazy initialization; false otherwise

      • writeOut

        protected void writeOut(E event)
                 throws IOException
        Overrides:
        writeOut in class OutputStreamAppender<E>
        Throws:
        IOException

      • subAppend

        protected void subAppend(E event)
        Description copied from class: OutputStreamAppender
        Actual writing occurs here.

        Most subclasses of WriterAppender will need to override this method.

        Overrides:
        subAppend in class OutputStreamAppender<E>
        Parameters:
        event - the log event
